thread.title: Not a luxury hotel; dated room - Review
thread.title_full: Not a luxury hotel; dated room - Review of Hotel de Vendome, Paris, France - TripAdvisor

author: ny_sv
title: Not a luxury hotel; dated room - Review
text:
The location of Hotel Du Vendome is fantastic. We walked everywhere. It does not get better then this because you are close to everything but it is quiet at night.
The hotel is in a historic building and the building, the lobby and common areas look charming.
The staff is multilingual, attentive and courteous.
We stayed in a Deluxe Suite #203. It is spacious and clean.
The room does not look like the picture on the website. It is in dire need of updating. It looks and feels worn out and not in a good vintage/antique kind of way but in an old and dingy way especially the faux wood panels.
There is a seating room and a bedroom - neither is comfortable.
The furniture in the seating room is not comfortable and after a day of exploring the city on foot it was difficult to relax.
There is a desk and an ottoman but it is not possible to work behind it without a proper chair.
The bed is uncomfortable and slightly slopes to one side. As one other reviewer mentioned, out of 5 pillows 4 are hard as a rock, and one is softer but it doesnâ€™t provide any support.
There is a hole in the wall in the bedroom. It looks like there was a picture there at some point...
I could not relax or get comfortable anywhere in the room throughout our 3 day stay.
The windows are very small and have mirrors all around to create an illusion of a bigger size but it does not look good.
We did not eat at the restaurant but order room service once. The food was good.
